_prev_prog_3.Description: Unity Envirotech of Illinois LLC - Henry Fertilizer uses the recommended matrix approach in preventing an accidental chemical release at the site. This involves safe practices in each aspects of the process including operations, handling, and transportation. We have a team of highly experienced and trained professionals including engineers, managers, supervisors who consider safety as a primary responsibility in their daily routine jobs.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: State of Illinois, Fertilizer Law, Subpart A, Anhydrous Ammonia

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary





Facility:  Centilion Fertilizers Company a dba of Unity EnviroTech of Illinois LLC    

           1557 County Road N 1400

           Henry, IL 61537-0216

Phone:    309-364-2361 



1.    Facility Policy



The owners, management and employees of Centilion Fertilizers Company - Henry Fertilizer are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Marshall County LEPC, and/or other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2.    Facility Information



The primary activity at our facility is the manufacture of fertilizer granule products consisting of nitrogen, phosphate & potassium and distribution of these products as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is used as a primary nitrogen source for making these products.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored, and is used in the production process.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose. 



    Consistent with the compliance guidelines and recommendations of 29 CFR Part 1910 and 40 CFR Part 68, Centilion Fertilizers Company. - Henry Fertilizer has developed a safety management system to minimize the potential consequences associated with manufacturing nitrogen fertilizers.  



    The management system provides procedures and plans to assist employees in conducting both routine and non-routine plant operations, identifying potential hazardous situations, and identifying actions to take during actual emergencies.

    

3.    The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 



An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.



4.    Accidental Release Preventi

on Program



Centilion Fertilizers Company - Henry Fertilizer personnel are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually striving to improve policies and practices intended to prevent releases of hazardous substances.  In the unlikely event of a release, Henry operations have an Emergency Action Plan in place to minimize the potential effects and implement emergency action procedures. 



The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).

    

    Centilion Fertilizers Company- Henry Fertilizer has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements as set forth in 29 CFR Part 1910 and 40 CFR Part 68.  



5.    Five-year Accident History



    There have been no accidental releases at the Henry facility in the last 5 years that have:  caused deaths, injuries or significant property damage at this facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering-in-place, property damage or environmental damage.



6.    Emergency Action Plan



    The facility has:



a.    A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38, to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan  addresses first-aid and medical treatment, local emergency response agency and public notifications, as well as post-incident management;



b.    Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).  Marshall County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee;



c.    If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of

the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

 

7.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Centilion Fertilizers Company - Henry Fertilizer relies on continual personnel training of procedures and of operating systems to improve safety.  Personnel training and procedure adherence combine to reduce the potential for accidental chemical releases.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility. Based on scheduled testing, sustaining and upgrading equipment serves to prevent releases from equipment failures.



There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
